alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Chester; Union; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Laurens, Chester, southwestern York, southeastern Spartanburg, southeastern Cherokee and Union Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of York to near Union to 13 miles north of Laurens. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Union, Chester, Clinton, Monarch Mill, Joanna, Buffalo, Lockhart, Sharon, Carlisle and Hickory Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
